Interests refer to an individual’s preference for engaging in one or more speciﬁc activities relative to others. It involves the activities that excites and gives you enjoyment, including what you like to watch, shows you like to attend, and the kind of people you admire and like to be with. Interests reﬂect a person’s preferences, attitudes, values, talents, and qualities. Interest is important in choosing a career because interest keeps you motivated and engaged in your work. Since you spend most of your time during a day and week at the workplace; if you have no interest in what you are doing, it can adversely aﬀect your personal life.

Career counselor plays an important role in accurately interpreting the psychometric test result. Assessment tests are surely beneﬁcial, but ultimately it has to be your own choice by considering all factors in selecting a career and/or course-discipline. Career counselors can help sort out these issues. Career counselor provides guidance in setting goal and preparing an action plan based on the results obtained by the student in the psychometric test. Career counselors always keep the information obtained from the tests conﬁdential.

Skill Finder Test is a standard and scientiﬁc method designed to measure an individual’s suitability for a role/career based on his/her interests, skills, multiple intelligences and other related factors. This test can evaluate an individual and provide an objective measure of his/her interests or career preferences. It is constructed by following the psychometric testing guidelines and scientiﬁcally proven theories and it is scientiﬁcally validated and standardized. This test is suitable for the Indian context.
